Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tarja59
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel in a very good location near all the biggest attractions, also easy to use the tram - one of the stops is near the hotel. Clean and big room with well equiped shower. Only thing I could complain a bit was the breakfast, which was exactly the same every morning (stayed for five nights, so started to get tired of it). Would recommend to take the squeezed orange juice (costs extra). Got also useful recommendation for a restaurant, where to celebrate our bithday. I also used the spa, where I went for foot massage after walking three days around Istanbul. Very relaxing - feet were like new after that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: 4traveljunkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on a city holiday break, travelling as a couple. What we liked - a lot - was a) the superb location (most key attractions within walking distance - as are tram stops); b) the price (we booked via Expedia); c) the view of the Bosphorus (we were on the 6th - top - floor) and d) the international clientele which added colour and charm. What we liked less - though it wasnt a huge problem - was 1) paper thin walls - we could hear everything in the room next door; 2) a limited breakfast with almost no fruit and little else that you would expect in a hotel like this and 3) a curious check-in process where we were first not given the room we had booked (superior room with view) and then - suddenly - we were given the right room. Be aware that right next to the hotel there is a major construction project with all noise/dust etc implications. It looked like it had quite a few months to run still.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel but avoid to stay in lower floor”
Reviews.Author: macatcat
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time to stay in this hotel which locate in the old city area which means that the Archeological Museum, Tile Museum, Museum of Ancient Orient, Topkapi Palace, Saint Sophia Museum and the Blue Mosque are all within 350m, the Grand Bazaar is 900m. All these famous sites are in walking distance. The hotel has renovated since i stayed last time, very modern, breakfast include in the room rate, service is okay....but there are a few things that you should be aware when you choose this hotel: 1. Some taxi driver (actually all) will not go into this area in the city except from the airport. I don't know why may be because of the construction going on near by. 2. Besure you have this hotel map when you arrive and take a taxi from the airport to show the taxi driver. 3. Avoid to stay in the lower floor, this time we stay on the 1st floor and we can hear the sound from the coffee shop (at the basement) until late. After all, i will choose this hotel again because of its prime location and clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value-for-money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Argiro S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to the most important archaeological sites of Istanbul and two tram stations. The rooms are clean and minimally decorated, the staff is very friendly, with a good command of english and the food is tasty. I would highly recommend for business trips as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Hotel in a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: MoandCr
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days in the hotel Primnce in late January. It was close to the main rail station and tram loop and was perfect for the major tourist sights. The room was more than acceptable with an excellent bathroom and minibar facilities with a modern plasma TV and tea/coffee making facilites. Breakfast was a buffet with something for everyone and both room service and the menu for other meals was good. Staff were friendly and helpful with most speaking at least some English. There was a great view from the roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and stay in general”
Reviews.Author: NZLou
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a few nights as part of a tour - so expecting the worst rooms (that tours always get) I was pleasantly surprised to get a room that was modern, clean and really comfy. Granted, my room didn't have a view (but who's in a hotel room long enough to want one?), but all the mod cons (big flatscreen TV, AMAZING shower, etc etc) were a real plus. Only a 10 minute "tourist" walk (i.e. slow and looking at shops on the way) up to the Blue Mosque etc as well as down to the port. Always felt safe in the area. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but it will surprise you. Note that you're not supposed to bring drinks/food in from outside, and because of this the mini bar rates for water etc aren't too bad. But if you hide stuff in your bag it's fine ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Sultanahmet!”
Reviews.Author: txhayden09
Reviews.Content: I came to Istanbul alone in December 2011 and I initially chose the Hotel Price due to the price I got and also the hotel seemed to be a great location. The hotel doesn't like the fanciest thing from the outside, but it is well worth staying here! There is free WiFi here which is great if you don't have a way to stay in touch with family. The free breakfast is big and has a lot of variety, however they do charge for fresh OJ but there is other options. The location is great but when I was there a construction site across the street which was really noisy. The rooms are modern and have great amenities, I loved the shower head in my shower! The staff is professional and helpful. The hotel is easily accessible to tramlines, Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, and Tokapi Palace.

Reviews.Title: “SAMIKOG 'Great Location. Very Clean. Good Food`”
Reviews.Author: Sami K
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 2 nights in this hotel, hotel was amazing, the food was great, the rooms was comfortable and clean, had a good location,Tramlines just 2 minutes walk from the hotel. Staff is very frendly, no fake faces:) I would recomended this hotel to people who will go to Istanbul. You will not be dissapointed with Hotel Prince. I will defenetly go back again if I'm going to Istanbul. Thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Good People.”
Reviews.Author: jethmalani
Reviews.Content: we would like to thank ulas, turan.. They are good souls and always ready to help and advice. They made us feel at home. We stayed for 8 days and we did not see much change in the breakfast menu.. Just one dish use to change everyday... In the last days we use to skip our breakfast as we got bored. The housekeeping people were excellent in servicing the room. I must say there is some archeological digging going on right next to the hotel and it was noisy at times.. But we were out most of the day so did not trouble us much... In the night it was much peaceful. The hotel is in a fantastic location and if you undersrand the tramlines you see the whole of istanbul quiet easily as we did... Tramlines just 2 minitues walk from the hotel. Great stay... Will be there again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid location, clean hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Aamir B
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located at the Gulhane tram stop, which makes it easily connected to areas outside of Sultanehmet like Galata Tower and Taksim Square. Main attractions like Topkapi palace, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Spice Bazaar, and Grand Bazaar are 10 minute walk maximum. Staff was very friendly and accomodating. Price was a little expensive in my opinion for off-peak season, but hotel was clean, and a solid complimentary breakfast buffet in the morning made up for the expense. Rooms were a little small, but again, clean and manageable. Would recommend if looking to do the touristy stuff in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_on_the_move
Reviews.Content: The Prince is in a central location close to all the main sights so you can easily walk and explore this wonderful city. Rooms are quiet and very comfortable with a good shower and the supplied breakfast menu is excellent. Two computers are available in the foyer and are free of charge. Staff are very polite and speak good english. Be sure to visit Istanbul in April so you can see the millions of tulips in bloom along the road side and in the beautiful Turkish gardens. We found out during our trip that tulips originated in Turkey not Holland as we thought.

Reviews.Title: “Prince Hotel”
Reviews.Author: advisor71_11
Reviews.Content: Self rated 04 Star accommodation. Located in central place. I stayed four nights. Wifi was not working properly. Breakfast was good but every day they have same menu.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: herrulf
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and found it very friendly with a perfect location. Breakfast was excellent and the rooms were good.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Elspeth L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Prince initially because my tour of Turkey started from there. I stayed after because it was convenient, comfortable and I got a great price through Booking.com If you want to be in the heart of touristic Istanbul then the Prince serves its purpose. I had friends staying in other 4 star hotels nearby and the Prince definitely beat them hands down. It is clean, quiet and the staff are helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Raven711
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in the middle of Sultanahmet area; 5 minutes walk from Gulhane metro station on the T1 line; 10 minutes walk form Topkapi museum; walking distance from the Old Town attractions: Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, etc. The downside is the construction work beside the hotel and the breakfast doesn't have much variety.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: alrlangford
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located for visiting the tourist sites. It is reasonably priced. The staff on reception are OK but a bit unfriendly, it may be because english is not their first language.

Reviews.Title: “3 night stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dragonfly08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the prince hotel for three nights. Positives: great location. 10 mins walk to aya Sophia and the blue mosque. 15 mins walk to topkapi and archeological and turkish and islamic arts museum. Free wifi. 2 mins walk to the tram line. Negatives: Internet can be slow at times. Some construction next to the hotel ( but they start the construction at 9 and finish at 4 as I was told by the front desk so didn't find it very disruptive).

Reviews.Title: “Well located, good for touring”
Reviews.Author: VPaway
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to many sites or at least the tramway to ge to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia. Walked to the Galata Bridge and Spice Market; wandered through the area near the hotel. Close to the train station where Orient Express used to end/begin its trips. Would stay here again. Staff helpful with orienting when asked. Free internet in the lobby for guests with code from front desk. Breakfast (included) was plentiful with Turkish coffee & tea. Pastries interesting & typically Turkish.

Reviews.Title: “super service; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pattyann47
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel near tram just a couple of stops away from major tourist attractions. Wonderful breakfast. Even arranged a dinner reservation with free pickup and return service. Had lots of questions for them and they couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating, including a room upgrade. Very nice room complete with slippers! We are fairly picky travelers in our early sixties and would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “The Istanbul Prince”
Reviews.Author: Jacketwatch
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a fine hotel in a great area for tourism. The staff were always polite, rooms very clean and all went well from our P/U at the airport to or seamless departure. The major sites of IST are w/i walking distance and the area by the hotel is full of shops and genuine Turkish restaurants so eating and shopping out are full of options. Again two thumbs up for the staff. We felt very welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: knights1997
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, breakfast was pretty good, rooms were decent. Close to lots of the main sights. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “More like a 2 star!”
Reviews.Author: HassanTeetoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights with wife and two kids. It claims it's a 4 star but I can honestly say it's not even a 3. 1st night we found cockroaches in the bathroom, we complained but instead of upgrading us they decided to cover the hole with a tea towel only after I complained the second time they then got someone to put insect spray. They didn't even offer a complimentary meal. I spoke with the manager, he seemed as though he wasn't empowered to offer anything, things seemed tight at the hotel. They seemed like a company that was going under administration. Their staff seemed underpaid and miserable.We paid approx Â£180 a night, was peak season, but we got a room with a dirty stained sofa, breakfast I wouldnt feed to the pigs and Â£2 a glass to get fresh orange juice, which is considered a standard at a 3 star. I've never written a review before but felt compelled to write this one in hope that you don't spoil your trip

Reviews.Title: “Parking problem”
Reviews.Author: amandawest01
Reviews.Content: Ostensibly the four star hotel is a standard city centre hotel and most guests will be more than happy if they get a reasonable price. However, our stay was tarnished when a member of staff took our rental car out of the hotel parking and got us a traffic ticket for which we were charged once we returned home! We thought we had put our car in the hotel parking for 4 days and it would be safe, as it's a 4 start hotel - not true. Unfortunately, to the discredit of the management of Hotel Prince, they stupidly denied all knowledge of this traffic ticket, even though we hadn't driven the car during the 4 days we were in Istanbul. They even tried to concoct a story that we had asked for a restaurant recommendation in some obscure suburb where the offense was committed even though we have no knowledge of Istanbul and it was our first time in the city. For our part, this is totally unacceptable behaviour for a hotel, let alone a 4 star hotel - but you be the judge... Oh, and the breakfast was very poor with poor help yourself machine coffee and heavily diluted juices and an unappetising buffet. If you wanted fresh juice, they charged you for the privilege.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff and bad service”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller2088
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were very unwelcoming and rude. The room was disappointing and the breakfast offered was standard. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place at key location”
Reviews.Author: Slobodan Z
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the old city. Rooms at 4 star level hotel. Staff was friendly, helpful, efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and Great location”
Reviews.Author: joelNantes
Reviews.Content: Great location; next to a wide variety of sight seeing location. The Hotel staff was really helpfull, efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at great sight-seeing location”
Reviews.Author: Wama10
Reviews.Content: From the booking, the check-in to the check out there was not a single problem and nothing to complain about. For the road construction and the difficult access to the hotel the hotel cannot be blamed. Why the sauna is not included in the room rate is a mystery to me. But all the wellness area has been immaculate clean and the hamam has been great. The w-lan reception in my room on the 3rd floor has been rather weak. I stayed with four friends and all would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jan h
Reviews.Content: although my trip was booked in holland and the hotel was supposed to be the royal orka they had troubles with the room they send us for two nights to the hotel prince lucky for me that hotel & room was much better then the one at the orka royal great breakfast,friendly service,great room,super location,great view from the roof definitly will return to this hotel when I return to Istanbul a must see city for anyone interrested in history,scenery,admosphere,ambience & good food I thank you for the great time I had

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJ1954
Reviews.Content: I booked 5 night's accommodation at the Hotel Prince through my travel agent. I wasn't sure what to expect but found the accommodation fantastic, location very central to all the main sight-seeing spots. The staff (reception, bar, restaurant and night staff) were all without exception friendly, helpful and attentive at all times. Rooftop restaurant has amazing views of the city, river and bridges, especially by night. Great buffet breakfast available each morning. However, highlight of my stay was the Turkish Bath and massage I had in the Wellness and Spa centre downstairs!! Many thanks to Balee (??) for his services! I would highly recommend this expereince if you have the time while you're staying at the Hotel Prince!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: salmog
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a hotel with such great service! The staff right from the bellboy to the management were fantasitic! We enjoyed ourselves greatly. Everyone treated us with respect, kindness, and took time to have a conversation with us everyday. I have no complaints and would recommend this hotel to whomever wanted to go to istanbul. Absolutely fantastic! Worth more than the money we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Caring employees”
Reviews.Author: bonhen
Reviews.Content: When my husband became ill during the night, the night manager immediately called for a taxi and had the driver take us to an excellent hospital where he received fine treatment. The day manager and concierge Songul Acik were very helpful. I cannot thank them enough. The hotel was comfortable, clean and had a fine breakfast buffet. We would stay there again if we're in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Appropriate price-performance ratio”
Reviews.Author: Manfred S
Reviews.Content: We had chosen the Prince Hotel for its strategic location and for the magnificent view from the roof terrace. After reading a lot of hotel reviews we were a little bit confused about their range from very good to miserable. We stayed from September 13th trough 20th 2011 and experienced friendly staff, normal size rooms, normal tidiness. The breakfast buffet was with coffee, tea, Juice (instant), water, fruits, yoghurt plain and sweet, Eggs boiled and scrambled a choice of cheese and sausage and various bred, rolls and sweets. Although that was more than one could eat there was a menu offering additional fresh juice omelets and more at extra cost. The location was perfect: Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Big Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, train station, habour and a lot more sightseeing points were in walking distance. The tramway station GÃ¼lhane was just around the corner; from there we could discover more of Istanbul. Around the other corner was a construction site of a future Metro station. During our stay there was no visible action and no noise and we could not see if there was something happening underground. Once that Metro station is finished the location of the hotel will be even better. The roof terrace was opened; the view was really magnificent in daytime and even more at night when the city was illuminated. The view is worth to improve the service as the terrace (7th floor) is served from the bar at the ground floor and from the kitchen in the basement. Altogether the Prince Hotel gives its service at an appropriate price-performance ratio. We can rec-ommend this City Hotel to everyone who wants to go out and discover Istanbul. Whenever we come to Istanbul again we would chose the Prince Hotel again. Special thanks to Mrs. SongÃ¼l Acik from Guest Relations who was taking care of her guests very friendly. Brigitte and Manfred

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Barbara N
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Prince Hotel in May 2011, with my parents and sister visiting from New Zealand, as well as my partner. The hotel was beautiful, staff very friendly and helpful, and the room clean, comfortable and well serviced. Breakfast was absolutely fine. Reception staff were very good, helpful with where to go and getting eg taxis organised. The roof top terrace was great, with beautiful vistas around the city. Its ideally located in historic Istanbul, within walking distance of fantastic sites. Great local cafes, restaurants and bars. Loved it and would stay here again if in Istanbul in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Little gem tucked away in good location”
Reviews.Author: Nyree13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. The location meant we could walk easily up the hill to Hagia Sofia and the Topkapi Palace, and the tram route was very handy. A highlight for me was the view from the room down onto an archaeological building site, with the ancient Roman walls of the city clearly visible! Our room was compact, well-appointed, and everything worked well. The breakfasts were excellent, with a very good variety of foods laid out, and a reasonable quality 'free' orange juice drink as an alternative to the freshly-squeezed, extra-cost orange juice available at the desk. We had supper on the roof of the hotel, which was a lovely experience with all the lights of Istanbul to view. Everyone was very friendly and helpful and we were very pleased to have experienced the Hotel Prince.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: My recent visit to the Prince Hotel (Sept 2011) was my fourth visit to this remarkable hotel. Located in one of the prettiest areas of Istanbul (Gulhane Park region) the Prince Hotel is ideally situated for short walks to the Hagyia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar and is also moments away from the Gulhane tram stop which takes visitors right into the heart of the city (to Taksim Square). Smart but unremarkable as a building from the outside, the Prince is modern and welcoming inside. Standard rooms are modest in overall size but the large area dedicated to the bathroom is a big advantage, as is the powerful and effective shower unit. The rooftop terrace is an unexpected bonus with its fabulous views over the Bosphorus down to Besiktas and the cruise liner terminal. Lunch or dinner on the terrace is a highlight to any visit to this charming hotel. Breakfasts are substantial affairs with both hot and cold buffets and some of the best caffelatte anywhere in the Med from their magic machine! The kitchen is surprisingly good for lunch or dinner with a wide choice of high-quality dishes. But the best thing about the Prince is its staff who are among the friendliest and helpful of any hotel I have visited around the world. Their genuine interest in their guests and smiling, "can-do" attitude make it a pleasure to stay there. Having stayed at some 5 star hotels in Istanbul before I found the Prince, I would not want to stay anywhere else from now on. Whether you are staying for holiday or business reasons, I can strongly recommend this hotel as a base to discover the enchanting city of Istanbul. John L Surrey, UK

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back this winter! Staff is very responsible, polite and attentive.”
Reviews.Author: Aytan G
Reviews.Content: I would like to note very good work of the staff , which is very responsible, attentive and nice. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. Room service is also very good. We really enjoyed our stay in the Prince Hotel. Location of the hotel allows to reach the main historical places easily. Breakfast served with fresh and multifarious meal.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job - friendly, welcoming, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lesley R
Reviews.Content: My aged father and I had a great stay. Neither of us is very mobile but the staff were very considerate at all times. They organised an excellent value for money tour, taxis etc. and could not have been kinder. Everything was clean, air conditioning worked ( we were shown how to work it properly on arrival). The view from the terrace was lovely - particularly at night when the bridge and mosques were lit up. There is a lot of building work going on throughout the city, so you see that too, but the hotel is quiet. We hope to return soon! PS We loved the freshly squeezed orange juice! If you wanted other juices for no extra cost they were available on the buffet. Perhaps they could be given a more prominent position on the buffet?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Alice R
Reviews.Content: The most friendly staff you could ever imagine, very clean modern rooms with large bathroom and had a nice breakfast . Great location with all the major sights within walking distance and the tram stop is very close if you're venturing further afield. There was no problem leaving extra luggage while we on a two week tour of Turkey. We enjoyed our stay immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Callo1950
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in Sultanamet walking distance to Blue Mosque, Grand bazaar waterfront and all ancient sites. Great resytaurants and bars close by. You will save a fortune staying here rather than across the bridge near cruise teminal area. .

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful ancient place”
Reviews.Author: TehranKatty
Reviews.Content: It was the first time we were coming to the Istanbul; but now I think it is not the last time. The place of the Hotel was very beautiful, an ancient place with interesting cafes. transportation to other parts of city was very easy. The hotel's staff were very kind. I propose if you want to go to istanbul You choose this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thewalrus1954
Reviews.Content: Hotel Prince is a nice hotel and well located being within walking distance of Istanbul's most famous sights. The room was generous in size and to a very good standard. The staff were excellent, in particular Turan who was very helpful and always had a smile on his face. Nothing was a problem. This is a hotel that we would be happy to stay in again. We appreciated being able to get ice for our room (many hotels in Turkey do not give this service which is frustrating).

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Jjaymoh
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are tidy and clean and the atmosphere around the hotel is good. The hotel is located in close proximity of the main attraction areas and the tram station is also very close to access distant attraction areas. The gym is nice and I got the massage which was also very well done even though I came at the last hour before closing. The staff at the reception was generally friendly and knowledgeable staff but sometimes the seemed impatient. I found the training/foreign staff to be more welcoming and willing to go an extra mile to attend to guest needs. The breakfast was just okay, it was very limited. At breakfast, it is where I experienced a bad service. The tea was very bad and I requested â€œblack teaâ€� bag to make the tea myself with available hot water. I was told it would have to be charged extra. Went to my room and brought the complementary tea bags and the complementary tea bags to make my tea at breakfast. Then, when my room was cleaned later the tea bags were not refilled in my room. Reported this to reception, and he argued with me over a tea bag. My overall rating is good. Thus, I would consider staying at hotel prince again hoping I would not get the breakfast debacle again. I will be in Turkey again in December with a big group, let us see where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “I like it very much”
Reviews.Author: Tom_xfaquarium
Reviews.Content: The room and the service are good, also the location is good, the staff Turan is very funny.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: JenniGee
Reviews.Content: the Prince Hotel was a great place to stay. Turan was great. he will help you with any tours you want to go on around Istanbul. rooms were terrific but make sure they don't smell of smoke - ours did.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, gr8 location, will be back”
Reviews.Author: gadsho
Reviews.Content: for travelers wishing to be near heart of IST in a quite, pleasent, modern, clean place. GR8 value fo rmoney.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to location it was OK”
Reviews.Author: ClaridgeHotelZurich
Reviews.Content: We preordered a transfer from the Airport to the Hotel - when we arrived, of course, there was no one with the PRINCE sign. We search for about half an hour and finally called the Hotel and they did not know anything about the prepaid transfer Location of the Hotel is great if you come sightseeing: everything within walking distance. However rooms are about 3-* level: typically low level furniture, no coatrack to hang your wet rain coats, windows not to be open properly and no shelfs or storage in the bathroom for your toilet bag. The rack for the bathtowels is in the shower cabin, so the second to shower will get a wet one and no hooks to hang the used towels. There is no other possibility to throw on the floor. - W LAN did not work during the whole stay. At breakfast buffet you pay extra if you do not want to drink the mouldy coffee out of the hotpot where it had been since several hours. There are no fruit juices on the buffet - for an orange juice you pay several Euro extra. After 9 AM they did not care to fill up anymore. I suppose there is their problem ... If you want to use their fitness room or sauna, you again pay extra, about 35 Euro for one hour.

Reviews.Title: “staff went out of their way to help”
Reviews.Author: LizPhil24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel twice as part of a Peregrine tour of Turkey. The rooms were comfortable and the hotel itself was in a quiet spot but still very close to the main attractions. On our first visit the neighbours were noisy and we complained. The problem was efficiently dealt with. However what impressed us most was the service provided by the staff, in particular Turan, who went out of his way to assist us with a problem we had mailing an item. The staff posted it for us as we could not due to public holiday restrictions. Nothing was too much trouble. Even in a city known for its hospitality this was remarkable. We would recommend the hotel to anyone staying in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NorthantsRyanair
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location for all the main sites in the old city. 5 minute walk to anywhere. Hotel was clean, and fairly quiet. Food in the morning was a good choice. Tour buses stay in this hotel. Overall good place to stay for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of the tour”
Reviews.Author: Jenmaryb
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the beginning and end of our small group tour. Rooms are well equipped, staff are pleasant and helpful. There's free tea and biscuits at 16.30. Beds were comfortable and it's well placed within walking distance of main sights of Sultanahmet. It was the best hotel of the tour. I checked in online for my flight and printed boarding passes: no charge from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional services and room facility is badly - not so-called 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maryfern2001
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed 3 nights in this hotel last week for holidays. We enjoyed the beautiful Istanbul in spring, but not the stay with Prince Hotel! We encountered the unprofessional assist from the hotel manager and stuff. We requested for the hotel map, the stuff asked for TL 5 for it. it's ridiculous to get the hotel location information from the receptionist! The hotel manager changed our room in the 2nd day of our stay, without informed us and removed all our unpacked staff to the relocated new room (even we had provided contact cell phone number when we checked in).This was horrible experience and happened in this 4-star hotel! The room's was smelly, caused by the air-cond and the water couldn't flow at the shower tub. We had to ask for two times of the room-service assistant. The hotel is facing the construction side, it's noisy! and have to pay for the gym facilities! We do not recommend you to stay in this hotel, with paying such amount, you could get better hotels in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Simply One of The Best Hotels in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed_Mostafa
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels that I had seen during any of my trips to Istanbul. 1- The hotel's staff were very helpfull, friendly & polite, they are always seeking to assist and give great advices during your stay "Special mention to Mr. Turan Denizli and Mr. Semir" 2- The service were professional & exemplary. 3- The rooms is modern, tidy, quite clean, it's really matching to the 5 stars standards. 4- The location is very quiet & more than great, where it's very close to "Istanbul Old Town", as well as all transportation are available to reach anywhere in Istanbul. 5- Breakfast restaurant had alot of fresh and tasty varieties. 6- Wonderful (24/7) Room Service, quick responding to any request at any time. 7- The value for money is a bit higher than other hotels in the same location, but it's still good comparing to others' services. I would really highly recommend this hotel to anyone who seeking the real enjoyment during his trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The staff went out of their way to ensure we had a wonderful experience in Itsanbul”
Reviews.Author: DOME2011
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the staff and service were exemplorary. Never too much trouble, always seeking to assist and offer relevant advice. Whether it was storing our luggage or what to see and how best to get there. They virtually acted as a tour guide for us!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel for a tourist as it is close to all the sites!”
Reviews.Author: eddygoraieb
Reviews.Content: welcomming staff, nice rooms, spacious luxurious bathroom, lots of facilities. the masseur and masseuse are very good. sauna quite good Bad points: Breakfast should be of a better standing. good selection but not tasty. Turkish bath is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BlueNick
Reviews.Content: Hotel Prince works well for a weekend in Istanbul. Location, facilities and staff are all good. The photo makes it look a bit Soviet-era but it's right where you want to be for walking around the main attractions. Message to the management: provide fresh orange juice for free at breakfast and provide some decent coffee, not a truly terrible Nescafe coffee machine. Oranges and coffee don't cost much.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RelTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience at this hotel which is centrally located. We did have a very long journey from the ataturk airport to the hotel due to traffic. It is not possible for cars to get close to the hotel due to the construction work. We had to get down about 200 feet from the hotel and had to walk through a narrow passage to get to it. There were people from the hotel to help us with the luggage though. Not everyone in the reception speaks proper English and they didnt have very many maps and such about. The breakfast is quite ok - but it does get a bit boring after 3 days. They do charge for beverages other than water. We got the idea that they try to get people moving by removing our cutlery even before we finish our meal. We had to tell them a couple of times that we were not done ! The location is very central near the Gulhane tram stop. It is quite easy to walk to the Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern & Hagia Sofia which are all located around the next tram stop from Gulhane. It does get a bit noisy at night but I suppose it is impossible to avoid that in Sultanahmet. The rooms are tidy and well maintained. We were surprised as we were expecting the room to be really small but it was just fine and we had plenty of space for our baggage. The only problem was that we would have prefered a double bed and what we got was 2 twins for the 3 of us. The free Wi-fi didnt work too well and we had to come down to use the internet. It was a nice place to stay but there is room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful reception,Verygood service,location,easy to reach anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: moalawar
Reviews.Content: We had very nice time,reception staff helped us a lot during our stay specially mr.Turan and mr.zafaar.The hotel is modern ,clean,good breakfast,easy to reach any place in Istanbul. Very close to ayasofia,sultan ahmed,and grand bazar.The hotel in old city and has city view.

Reviews.Title: “The Fantastic Prince Hotel is everything you want for your stay in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: JennyM57
Reviews.Content: We (an Australian couple) have just had 5 days at the Prince Hotel - 4 nightsbefore joining a tour, and one night, two weeks later, on our return. It was an excellent motel in so many ways. The position was such that it was only a short walk to all the major sites, and with a tram stop only a two minute walk away, everything was convenietly accessed if you didn't feel like walking. Restaurants galore in this area for night time dining. The staff were lovely, helpful and friendly. The rooms were comfortable with clean and well designed bathrooms and the breakfast was "to die for'. The amazing selection of food and beverages left you wanting for nothing, and feeling very satisfied for the rest of the day. There are massage facilities and spa and saunas as well. A little expensive, but very convenient and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Good service,clean, decent interior and cooperative staff”
Reviews.Author: narendra26
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be indeedÂ  worthy of 4 stars. The location is certainly odd as my car could not reach easily to the front and there was no parking facility inhouse even though it is near the main attractions of old city. For that matter the entire old city is very clusteredÂ  with narrow roads and difficult traffic.The breakfast (included in the hotel rates) could have been more elaborate in line with 4 star status, which it was not. The room was relatively small. Toilet was good. The health/SPA facility is commendable. On the whole I would recommend it to tourists as long as they charge reasonably.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: TasteItAll
Reviews.Content: Hotel Prince is superbly located about 1 block from the Gulhane Park Tram stop. Once on the tram, you are connected to ferry stops, metro stops, bus stops, and train stations. Using public transit you can easily go from the airport to hotel and to most points in the city. The hotel is within easy walking distance of all the major sites in the Sultanahmet. The staff is delightful and tremendously helpful. (See Turan Denizli at the front desk for help using the tram and metro system.) The hotel is clean and comfortable. The hotel rooms are decorated like Ikea showrooms. There are fitness facilities as well as massage and a hammam. All of these amenities are at an additional cost (rather steep). Breakfast buffet is included with some hotel packages. The buffet had good variety but the food was of marginal appeal. Fresh orange juice and egg dishes cost extra. For location, convenience, and great hotel staff, you really couldn't do better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Euroman2000
Reviews.Content: I would like to commend the outstanding attitude and commitment to guest service from the front desk mgr. of the Hotel Prince in Istanbul. I think his name was Turan Denizi? I may be spelling it wrong but anyway he was enthusiast, very helpful, and this man definitely is dedicated to making sure the hotel guests feel comfortable by helping with suggestions on where to go and helping with directions in an easy manner. He has excellent command of English and is a tremendous asset to the Hotel Prince Istanbul. Ludovic Coutinho USA

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: Julietlauren
Reviews.Content: The Prince Hotel has an enviable position in the historical sector. Most of the main sites are walkable. Any misgivings I may have were beyond the control of the very helpful hotel staff. The local municipality are/were renovating the pavements and this caused considerable disruption late into the night. That said, it is a great hotel well located. If you can afford it try try the Turkish Bath and Aromatherapy in lower ground floor. Bliss!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very walkable and close to the main attractions for first time visitors. Would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “cost-effective and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jennyaodelin
Reviews.Content: 1ï¼ŒEnvironment, service accord with 4 star standard 2ï¼ŒFrom parking to deal with formalities, hotel staff in attitude are good, thanks a lot. 3,The room is spacious, window bright. good and convenient geographic location . 4,Supporting facilities is also good, speeds too fast of internet . 5,Whole decorates style have home feeling. Configuration is complete, the bed is big, i like it .

Reviews.Title: “This hotel give me home feeling.”
Reviews.Author: licachen
Reviews.Content: I am stay in this hotel before for the business. This is the second time I come here again for visiting some historical place.It let me fell like at home.It's good for the condition and also the traffic.All waiter and waitress has warn smile,with nice food.All this let me feel very very good. Whenever I come here again in the future,I will stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary, i'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Floreanicu
Reviews.Content: I recommend who is thinking to visit Istanbul or not, get rid of your concern and come to Istanbul and choose Hotel Prince to stay. Food was excellent, clean service, helpful and cheerful staff, great job Hotel Prince keep doing it!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Solo traveler..”
Reviews.Author: cindya28
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Turkey, i was really concern about my solo visit to istanbul before i met Hotel Princeâ€™s friendly staff. They were so friendly and helpful. Especially the reception was so helpful about where to go or what to do, i discovered orient and mystery of Istanbul coz of Hotel Prince. Definetely will come back!!

Reviews.Title: “i want to live there every day if possible”
Reviews.Author: guoyina
Reviews.Content: it is a good hotel ,good servive and best environment ,i stay there like at home so i recommend this hotel to you ,you can have a try there it is suitable for live and travlling there ,if you have a chance ,pls choose it you will have a deep relax

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Ayse1001
Reviews.Content: I stayed with friends in this hotel at the end of December 2010 beginning of January 2011 and it was just excellent! The location is superb, located in the old City Centre of Istanbul, with a walking distance to a lot of historical sights. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are really clean. I would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: turtolisto
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there last month, and i really liked there..Good location, very kindly staff, free wi-fi, clean rooms and affordable prices. I can recommend there, have good holidays.!!!

Reviews.Title: “superb experience and great personal touch”
Reviews.Author: hocam1432365
Reviews.Content: There is so much to say about our stay at this great hotel. And although the location and service was excellent, it was the very special talents of one employee in particular, Ms. Miray Yavuz, who proved so very, very, very helpful. Her English was excellent. But more than that, her knowledge and sense of the world. We talked about her as much as the great city of Istanbul when it was all over. She was that good!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: RitaChina
Reviews.Content: Excellent and Comfortable, Quiet We like this hotle, and we hope there will be more and more people stay there

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels in istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: charitasjar
Reviews.Content: I have been here in december 2010 and the location,service and rooms are absolutely worth the price!! The staff is helpfull and nice,the rooms are very good en the hotel is nearby everything. I will defintely go back to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: yazas
Reviews.Content: I can recomment this hotel for anyone who is intending to visit Istanbul shortly. Professional and friendly staff, excellent service, near to the historic areas of Istanbul, etcetera.

Reviews.Title: “I've appreciate the comfort of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: aysenice
Reviews.Content: Pleasant staff, comfortable room, it offers everything I need.

Reviews.Title: “best experience in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Demetistheuser
Reviews.Content: I live in USA and was looking for a nice place to stay during my visit in Istanbul. I finally found Hotel Prince and decided to stay there for a week. It was a great decision!! I was amazed with the service and the overall quality. It surpassed every expectation I had prior to my visit. The rooms were big and very comfy, the decor was elegant and modern. The food was amazing!! Everything was fresh and tasted so good. The staff was polite and extremely helpful. The location is great too. It is in a very central location and has easy access to public transportation which might be useful for those who don't have a car. And you can't beat the price!!!!! Istanbul is an expensive city, especially when it comes to hotels! Hotel Prince was a great deal for me, because I was staying for a week, not just for a weekend. I feel like I got a great value for my money. I really don't have anything bad to say about this hotel. Everything was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Landrad
Reviews.Content: Â Hotel on the model of sophisticated and promising for the better and the staff are friendly and eager to better service

Reviews.Title: “Most polite and helpful staff ever met in a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: giannakouti
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent staff. Great smile at the lobby with kindness and politeness. The room was clean and nice. The room service was really good. There was an abundant breakfast. At the lobby area there is a spot (desk) with 3 computers with Internet access free of charge. The only thing we did not like was that it is difficult to spot the hotel when you are arriving there by car.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dg1903
Reviews.Content: It was really enjoyable to stay in this hotel. Hotel's location is very good, so you can easily access whereever you want. Also our room was very comfortable and staff was very cheerful. Hotel is very important for me in my trips and I highly recommend Hotel Prince.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, with very friendly and caring management”
Reviews.Author: buhal
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a strategic location in the old city of Istanbul, being close to both Hagia Sophia/Blue Mosque/Topkapi Palace and the Galata Bridge/Spice Market. Its management and staff were extremely friendly. They were very flexible with our group arrangements and helped us in any possible way they could. We had issues with airport customs and the hotel management helped us resolve these issues which went beyond their immediate responsibilities. It was really impressive how committed the management was to serving its customers in the best possible way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent customer service, home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: gulmelisa
Reviews.Content: Loved to be surrounded by history, experience Istanbul and all its glory, walking distance to museums such as Saint Sophia, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque. Beautifully designed hotel and spacious rooms felt like staying at a 5 star hotel. Friendly yet very professional staff made us feel like we were at home! Bravo, all the stars in the world for your hotel and staff! Gul and Allan Moore

Reviews.Title: “Good position, kind staff, solidly equipped”
Reviews.Author: DE1234
Reviews.Content: Compliments to the staff, especially to Mert, Mehmed and Ibrahim. Thank you...

Reviews.Title: “very helpful personnel”
Reviews.Author: sewyahoo
Reviews.Content: We were a large group (around 60) traveling for business. The hotel made lots of concessions for our group. They allowed flexible payment upon arrival which is not a common practice for hotels. They were very perceptive to our needs. The hotel reception was trying their best to help us at all times. Also I especially want to thank front office manager Mr. Turan Celiker for his efforts to help our group. We send packages on his name which were stuck at the airport customs office. He spent a whole business day with us to get those packages from the customs and he was not his job at all. The rooms of the hotel were renewed a couple of months ago and they were also very good.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels to stay, and i would recommend it to friends and business reletives”
Reviews.Author: ApStooker
Reviews.Content: One of the better hotels i stayed in. The staff is very friendly and also good with and for kids. Me and my daughter had a good stay there and they made our vacation really special. If you like a luxe hotel for a affordable price, than hotel Prince is the best choice. As being a Cruise Manager i know all about ratings and how important they are for other travelers to make sure they make a right choice for there stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the heart of historic Istanbul in a quiet and nice location and with helping staff”
Reviews.Author: abcdefgh_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very close to public means of transports, and also to historic (and shopping) Istanbul - everything you want to see is at walking distance. Excellent price/room level ratio. It is virtually in the heart of the city but in a sidestreet, which is ideal for sleeping! Rooms are spacious and shower is huge. At Hotel Prince you can really feel the hotel staff cares for your needs and for your wellbeing in a discrete way. They are really helpful and they do their best to accomodate your requests. The only thing they could improve is having at the reception desk more city plans and metro-tram maps (they had run out of them) and be updated about opening times of the nearby tourist attractions. This hotel is both the ideal place for a short break in the beautiful Istanbul and also for business: strolling between the beautiful monuments all lit at night, reliefs you from a hard busy working day!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Prince is comfortable, but be prepared to pay for ammenities”
Reviews.Author: fuzzydogman
Reviews.Content: Hotel Prince is comfortable and provides easy access to many of the historic sites in Istanbul, but be prepared to pay for the gym, sauna, and Turkish Bath, and don't expect a very fulfilling complementary breakfast (the coffee is horrible, and the best food is the hard boiled eggs). Oh, and the internet crawls along at a snails pace, when it's working that is and the fun parts of town (Taksim) aren't particularly accessible (although it's a short 10 minute cab ride). That said, the rooms are comfortable, the staff is friendly, and the amenities are nice (once you've paid for them).

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, everything else sucks”
Reviews.Author: TheBV
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very modern and comfortable. Location is fine if you have never been to Istanbul and are only spending a few days there, otherwise, stay in the new city. -1 for room not being ready when we arrived and a hairball in the shower -1 for a terrible breakfast and charging 2 euro for orange juice -1 for charging $80 for laundry. There must be better places to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great expectations, great location”
Reviews.Author: DavidQuena
Reviews.Content: We have been for 5 days in istanbul, we choose the prince hotel due to a great pass expiriences, but now the accommodation has even better, the hotel is a 4 starts with a great relation quality prince, even more out of the peak season, we only had a minor problem due to a misunderstanding/ gap of communication but was solve immediately and the business development manager, Nergiz Salur, offer us a free airport transfer in a luxury van, for us this is Customer focus, we are from Spain but we live in INdia and we perfectly know the important to be treat as personal guest no us customers. Thanks to all the great staff of prince hotet. David &quena

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL”
Reviews.Author: skorpina
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very nice and near to everything. the room was big and very clean. the staff very polite and friendly. the brakfast had variety of foods.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel within walking distance of most important attractions”
Reviews.Author: chokdii77
Reviews.Content: Hotel Prince is an elegant hotel. Although it is located in the downtown we didn't hear anything from the traffic noise. The room was spacy and clean, we were very satisfied with all of the hotel services. The only thing we weren't completly satisfied with is the breakfast. It was quite fine, we liked it, but it wasn't varied at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location with clean rooms, I would stay again at the Prince”
Reviews.Author: DrSheriff
Reviews.Content: Even though I just mentioned it is a great location and a clean place to stay. Only two things to mention on this particular hotel is, 1) The charge for a fresh orange juice cup was not a thing they need to do, as breakfast in other hotels in Turkey are a bit more generous with omelets etc. 2) Make sure that you count the drinks in your room fridge, as it seems they are not really professional about it. I hope these comments are helpful for future guests.

Reviews.Title: “TOO SMALL WITH NO AMBIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Chrisinder
Reviews.Content: Good thing that I travelled alone - two persons can hardly fit into the small ''deluxe'' rooms with the most minute bathrooms ever encountered. But, all was functional, clean and in good working order exept the so called sea view as per the hotels good website consists of roof views. Location is central but also very quiet in a side strret - another reason why I had selected the hotel. A new but empty Turkish Bath, Sauna and Gym area had just been opened but again lacked ambience with prices too high for travellers staying in this type of hotel. Bar was empty throughout my stay and the restaurant busy during breakfast only which I had only once and gave up. Very poor choice, no service and the orange juice albeit fresh, is being charged for. Overall the staff lacks not in efficiency but definately in friendliness and customer care. Chrisinder

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, will love to come back...”
Reviews.Author: AusBrad
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Istanbul with friends. Stayed in a Triple room which was exactly what we wanted, both very spacious room and bathroom. They have a new SPA salon, and offered us free 5 minute trial massage. We took turkish bath and foam massage - really nice! The weather in Ä±stanbul was very comfortable - cool in the mornings and evenings but warm and sunny during the day time. So nothing more can be expected!

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul and the Prince”
Reviews.Author: dewzen
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a very busy city and for me a peaceful retreat after a day in downtown was paramount. As such I wanted a central hotel which would allow me to see the most important sites without the hassle of traffic, but with a pleasant atmosphere and restful rooms. I found all this in the Prince Hotel. The staff was nice and helpful providing me with plenty of information and tips. Also they gave me useful information and offering a lot of suggestions as what restaurants are the best for my taste. The rooms are comfortable and made me feel as I was at home. I definitely would recommend the Prince Hotel for everyone who wants to enjoy their stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “"Great location, wonderful staff"”
Reviews.Author: lilly186363
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Istanbul on leisure with my husband recently and loved it. The hotel's location is central and convinient for shopping and going out. The staff couldn't be more helpful and pleasent. We are definitely going to come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in Prince Hotel!!! ( Gulnoza Uzbekistan )”
Reviews.Author: Gulnoza
Reviews.Content: We were really excited having 3 nights there. The service and furniture quite comfortable. I was there with my husband and advice fro all new married - You want to have best night - just stay in Prince Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Touch of the history”
Reviews.Author: Shamsiya
Reviews.Content: I think, the advantage of Prince hotel is that it is very close to all those wonderful historical buildings, where you can feel the touch with the history: Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Sultanahmet, Water Reservoir and Gulhane park. The one who wants to spend a good quality time visiting the city on business with limited time for sightseeing must consider Prince for sure. Its close location to major historical buildings of Istanbul enables you to enjoy the evenings in the company of magnificent historical touch! Fresh rooms and friendly staff make your visit unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelbug255068
Reviews.Content: We arrived late morning before check in time however staff were more than willing to give us our room. Excellent location, walking distance to Palace, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, cruises, mosques. Lots of restaurants and cafes within 2 minutes walk. Very comfortable beds with spacious rooms. Breakfast was traditional Turkish with a good variety. Would highly recommend this hotel to any tourist in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Robbie46117
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in quiet side street 2 minutes away from GÃ¼lhane tram stop. Egyptian bazar, New Mosque, Galata bridge and Sirkeci rail/ferry terminal all within comfortable 10 minutes walk. Everything we needed in terms of shops and services was nearby. Staff at reception very friendly, helpful and fluent in English language. Large, clean rooms with large, clean bathroom. Breakfast good for local standards. Next to the hotel was a building site which didn't cause any noise disruption during our stay. I recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I loved my stay at the Prince”
Reviews.Author: SelmaKazmaz
Reviews.Content: As a big criticus and an often solo traveller I must say that I loved my stay at the prince. The staff has an high service level and made me feel 'home'. I highly recommend this hotel and not only becouse it feels like home but also because of it's perfect location. Every must-sees in Istanbul are in reach. I loved it I am sure more people agree.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice large rooms, clean”
Reviews.Author: jinks_eng
Reviews.Content: A good deal for Istanbul compared to other hotels in the area location is excellent, close to important objectives, staff is very nice, rooms are big enough, the atrium construction is impressive. Unlike: the breakfast; not so many options and didn' t look to fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, helpfull staff at reception”
Reviews.Author: charlie189506
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Istanbul, the staff at the reception is so very helpfull and friendly!!!! Nothing is to much for them.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: skiowl
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is one of the worst hotels I have stayed in.. Breakfast watch out ... YES you do have to pay for the orange juice.... Tea and coffee in your room .... YES you do have to pay for that as well... Eating in the restaurant>>>> If your plate is dusty thats right dusty the waiter will blow the dust away... Thats all I have to say.....

Reviews.Title: “Very well serviced hotel, with friendly employees and a nice decoration”
Reviews.Author: NN61
Reviews.Content: The employees were very kind at the reception and especially Zeynep Misir.

Reviews.Title: “nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: csantosLisboa
Reviews.Content: it is to say that i had been in istambull at the end of july with my family at hotel prince which i consider very good for the service and staff, always ready to help amd to makke us at home,in particular to the lovely public relations Mrs Ilknur Eradan. the hotel its self is located in a very good position permitting an easy and quick visits to the main and most spots to visit. see you next time guys carlos santos

Reviews.Title: “A very clean,quiet and excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Msafiri2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Prince for 1 week in July 2010. The hotel is close to all the major tourist attractions and the tram is only 5mins away(Gulhane station).Its also close to the ferries that offer tours to the bhosphorous, marmar and golden horn. The Sirkeci train station is also close.. After a long day of visiting the museums, mosques, churches, palaces and shopping, we always found our room cleaned and nicely arranged. The beds are very very comfortable and you need that after a tiring day. The hotel is situated in a very quiet area with shops selling car parts all around, so at night the area has little activity. Check in and check out is swift, and the front desk staff and guest relations manager are always at hand to help. The view from the rooftop is beautiful especially at night..though some repairs are going on at the rooftop.. Our Aircondition worked perfect, infact we had to reduce it to low(1) as it was getting too COLD at night!!

Reviews.Title: “It was great hotel except one thing”
Reviews.Author: Mosaab
Reviews.Content: Actually, it was lovely and luxurious hotel. Every thing was clean the room and the bathroom . Stuff also were very helpful and friendly. In addtion, the hotel is located in a fantastic place near both marmara sea and sultanahmet mosque and it is just 10 minutes to taqseem area by tram or taxi. However, there was a bad thing during staying period, which is air conditioner. It turned to hot air at midnight until the afternoon almost everyday, and we contacted the reception many times to fix it, but without a reaction. I recommend it for all, but I hope first the hotel solve air conditioner problem. Mosaab from Saudi Arabia

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: walter007
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased to stay is this fantastic hotel. Our room 2203 was spacious, bathroom very good. Everything clean. Personel very friendly. The hotel is located near the touristic places in a small street, what means that it is very quiet. So donot look further and book this hotel. No, I am not a shareholder! Just a tourist from Holland.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: trooo3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Prince Hotel on a tour of Turkey. It was close to all the attractions like Hagia Sophia, palace, bazaar etc. It was a very neat little hotel jammed in amongst a whole lot of shops that seemed to wholesale auto parts. The staff were very helpful and the meals were fine though I could not understand why I had to pay extra for a glass of orange juice when the breakfast was so generous. I used the internet and learnt that not all keyboards are the same. It took me ages to figure out how to actuate a lot of the characters found on an Australian keyboard. Fortunately internet was free and so I was popular with other guests. I felt that the staff should have printed out a means of working some characters. Beyond that it was an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: chopinbach81
Reviews.Content: Great staff! Perfect location! I felt like at home. I will come back to Hotel Prince as soon a possible. Cheers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: susi08
Reviews.Content: Location is great, close to many places of interest, cafes, restaurants and a tram line. Our twin-room was very clean and quite roomy (compared to other hotels in other towns in Turkey). They provide you with a jug, tea-bags and coffee-bags but they charge you for using them. One Turkish Lira is for a teabag. At breakfast, as you come in, they will offer you a glass of fresh orange juice and if you take it you will need to pay 4 Lira when you check-out. There is also Internet connection but quite slow.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rayc101
Reviews.Content: We did not book this hotel; however due to 'technical difficulties at Yasmak Sultan Hotel, we were transferred here. The front facade is rather unremarkable but the hotel inside is beautiful. Our rooms were very comfortable - the most comfortable bed in my 3 weeks in Turkey. A very small balcony had distant glimpses of the Bosphorous. Breakfast was to die for! Location was very fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Sultanahmet Area”
Reviews.Author: LaLaMischa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were first time travelers to Turkey. With no previous experience in determining which neighborhood was better than another we chose Sultanahment for its convenience to the city's attractions. We opted for the Prince Hotel based on price and online reviews. We made the correct decision. As soon as we arrived the young lady at the guest relations desk took ample time to discuss the hotel and provide an overview of the surrounding area. She made sure all of our initial questions were answered. This level of service was pervasive during our four night stay. Never was a question left unanswered or a request not met. She even found multiple transportation options for us to use for the Formula 1 race which was over an hour away from the hotel. The hotel is extremely convenient to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the tram requiring only a short walk to all three. The complementary breakfast was not fine dining however it provided enough options to sustain us for the morning. The free internet access in the lobby and complementary Turkish tea were also nice features. I would not recommend this hotel if you are a business traveler on a large expense account, however if you are searching for a clean, convenient, relatively inexpensive property with a helpful staff the Prince should not be overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Prince Istanbul - not the very best place to be in this great city”
Reviews.Author: tatjanaz
Reviews.Content: I have chosen Prince Hotel, for it was one of the congress hotels, and looked good on the pictures, presenting itself as "safe business class hotel in the old city" (yes, it is safe, but Istanbul is a safe city in any case). If you are looking for a real 4 stars in Istanbul, try to find an internaitonal hotel chain. If you are looking for a nice location in the center of the city- go for something, which is chepaer, smaller and have family atmosphere. My first night at the hotel was in a room without a window- for 120 Euro per night not really acceptable. I have learned, that all my collegues, who stayd in this hotel, had this problem for the first night- if you want to change next morning, they do it without a proble, arguing, that "last night was overbooked", I have met 5 people, who have experienced the same. Then I got another one, which had even a balcony, but the room did not feel clean, and the restaurant is on the 01 flor without windows (the breakfast is however ok). There are hotels, which are cheeper, have worse breakfast, but nicer view. Hotel prince positions itself a a business hotel, providing all business hotel services, and feels like 2 stars, which aou are overpaying. Internet connection is for free and good; lokation is fine, but you have at leas 20 other hotel, situated as good as this one; people are nice and helpfull, still, if asked to pay more than 60 Europ per night, I would not do it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Daniela_7703
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 5 days in Istanbul with friends. Absolutely great location, at walking distance to all the major Istanbul historic sights. We would like to congratulate all of staffs and specially guest relations manager for the excellent service provided during our stay and feedbacks about Istanbul. It was almost like feeling home. Istanbul is a wonderful city, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Jamal_10
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time and, as always, we felt safe and comfortable at the Prince Hotel. I travelled with a large group and we took 4 or 5 rooms over. At all times the staff did their best to provide everything. Especially Mrs. Iknur at the Guest Relations was very helpful and kindly gave us good recommendations for tourist attractions. The hotel is in a convenient location. In 5 minutes of walking you would reach all the main attractions in center: Hagia Sofia, Tokapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, etc. Hotel is also close to the tram way. I would definitely recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but beware”
Reviews.Author: Looksat
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here. We arrived off the plane to be told that our room was damaged and we would stay at a sister hotel, (Nobel House.). The first room we were shown was out of the question. We were then shown another which we accepted, thinking we would be charged accordingly. The next day when it was time to settle we were charged the Princes room rate, more than Nobel House. The staff acknowledged our complaint but seemed powerless to do anything. Our transfer was free but we were entitled to this as a promotional deal. This scenario was repeated with three of our party, people we met on the next tour we did, and others we witnessed. They must have a policy of over booking. It's a great hotel but we were not confident when we returned that we would get a room. Otherwise a nice place, but be aware tea/coffee & orange juice and omelettes are extra.

Reviews.Title: “It has a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: PatrickPloderl
Reviews.Content: It has a perfect location. Hotel also had free wi-fi in the rooms . The hotel arranged for my transfer from the airport. We have a amazing stay in this hotel and Istanbul. The Guest Relations responsible was magnificent, she smiled us from her heart. We would be really happy stay here again and we already recommending to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Find a different place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WonderWilma
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff RUDE, unhelpful and extremely SLOW. I am not kidding when I say it took them 10 minutes to put my details in the computer only to tell me that I can not check in yet as it is too early. (I did not expect to be able to check in early) but I do expect it to take less than 10 minutes to assist me, maybe it took so long because the two guys were chatting to each other and laughing and so this distracted them from their job). Was not aware that Orange Juice at breakfast cost Seven Turkish Lira (AUD 5.50 approx) until check out time. This is deceiptful. When I told the front desk staff member that customers should be told that the Orange Juice is extra he laughed. My room was HOT - when I asked why the air con was not working I was told it was Winter so I do not need it - I would have thought that was up to me as to whether I needed it or not. I do not sleep well in a hot room. Please do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else a little more personal where you feel like a guest - not an inconvenience. People in my tour group said they were kept awake by construction noise - I must have been lucky as I did not hear it from the room I had - the room was clean and a good size as well as the bathroom. Is in a good location but so are many other hotels. Has free wifi that was a tad slow at times but pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AVOID AVOID. Smoky room, robotic staff and deceitful practices”
Reviews.Author: OnTopDownUnder
Reviews.Content: We were off to a bad start whent the staff at the front desk were so rude, dismissive and vague that it left a bad taste in my mouth. They barely acknowleded my prescence and would not answer my simple questions, such as "Have you found my booking?" There was another man and woman checking in at the same time and they interrogated the poor man about why he and his female friend were not staying in one room. They really went at him. They made checking in very difficult and then shove paper in your face to sign - without telling you what it is. The "non-smoking room" reeked of cigarettes and it was boiling hot but the A/C would not work. I (reluctantly) went down to reception to ask why the A/C did not work and I was told that it only works in summer as it wasn't hot enough. I asked how hot it was that day and he told me 28 degrees. I asked how hot it is in summer and he said about 26 to 35. At breakfast they tell you that you need to sign for breakfast and then give you a freshly squeezed orange juice. When you check out the bill shows that the juice was about US$6. Maybe they can use their deceitfully obtained OJ funds towards the aircon? I asked how much it was to organise a private car to Sabiha airport - I was told 25 euros for Sabiha airport. Later that day, being the day before my departure date, I went to book the car to Sabiha and was told that it 50 euros, not 25. I ended up catching a cab. They charge about US$0.75 for a tea bag and provide lukewarm water for a fee. To be fair - the room would have been nice if it didn't smell. The guest relations staff member was lovely - and busy too, given the amount of problems arising from her fellow staff. They also have free wifi - which works on and off from the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “the best choice”
Reviews.Author: Janezhou
Reviews.Content: incredibly hot and very comfortable accommodation with friendly staff have experience ! I was worried before I go on, but we've made the right choice and we remain very pleased.... Enjoy the istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: ofst
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice to stay in while in Istanbul. It is right behind the Gulhune tram station and right next to all the main tourist attractions in Istanbul. The room was big, beautiful and quiet with a big nice super modern bathroom. The room had everything you will expect from a high end hotel. WiFi is free in the rooms and free access to PC . We got a very good deal through Expedia. My only suggestion is to drop the charges for orange juice and special omelets at breakfast or drop these two item completely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and value”
Reviews.Author: deeann7
Reviews.Content: We contacted the hotel before our trip and arranged for an airport transfer, which was very convenient as the driver was waiting for us when we arrived. We were never charged for this service. Our rooms were ready so we were able to check-in right away which was also very nice. The hotel was located in a quiet neighborhood of small cafes, restaurants and shops. We were within walking distance of Topkapi Palace, Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Archeological Museum and many other sights. The tram stop was only a 2 block walk as well. There were many restaurants in all directions and within walking distance from the hotel. The concierge was delightful, spoke excellent English and was extremely helpful, even tho it was only her 2nd week at the hotel. She always greeted us as we entered or left the hotel and very kindly made dinner reservations for us. The hotel lobby had comfortable seating, a lounge, two computers with internet access (free for guests) and there were always cookies available, as well as afternoon snacks and tea. The breakfast room was quite large and was never overly crowded altho there were tour groups staying at the hotel. The fresh squeezed orange juice was delicious and we didn't mind paying the extra charge for it nor for the eggs to order if desired. Breakfast fare was a large assortment of breads and pastries, cereals, fruits, meats, cheeses, tomatoes, cucumbers, yogurt, hard boiled eggs as well as coffee and tea of course. Rooms were adequate in size, bed was comfortable and bathroom clean with good shower. Our only complaint was a musty smell from air conditioner that lasted about the first 15 minutes each time we entered the room. We never consumed anything in the refrigerator but used it to keep our purchased water cool - was nice to have it available. Room was very quiet. We would definitely stay here again as we enjoyed the location of the hotel and friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “evreything was great but telephon!”
Reviews.Author: maryamd
Reviews.Content: location, comforft, business center and staff are great but its not possible to call out of turkey directly

Reviews.Title: “very warm atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: backyardflowers
Reviews.Content: incredibly hot and very comfortable accommodation with friendly staff have experience ! I was worried before I go on, but we've made the right choice and we remain very pleased.... Enjoy the istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a great place to stay to explore Old Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: serefe57
Reviews.Content: Hotel Prince is a very modern, clean and comfortable place to stay in Istanbul. The location is within easy walking distance of many of the interesting historical sites around the Old City, along streets paved with cobblestones and centuries of stories from the Ottoman Empire and the Republic. The staff are very friendly and helpful to make a foreigner's stay enjoyable and memorable. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: indiSint_truiden
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Good location in the historical center. Very clean rooms, exellent bathroom. Delicious buffet breakfast. Free internet. Free happy hour (thee, coffee, baclava ).

Reviews.Title: “worth to try”
Reviews.Author: jinshenzhen
Reviews.Content: I feel pretty nice here. Large room, good service and free high speed internet! Actually, it is recommended by my friend. So, i just have a try. If i travel here again, i would still choose this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Icey338
Reviews.Content: even the bad review of english firend on the web,i dont agree her.coz even i am young lady,i selpt at the rooms so confort and all staffs are so helpful and polite.also for an hotel,we aceapt to pay only breakfast and room.so its so normal to pay the extracs money.and even these extra foods and drinks,hotel prince so cheap,clean and confort for visitors.so near to visiting historical

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: MissGunner
Reviews.Content: I've just spent a week in Istanbul and although the city is wonderful, I have only one regret: the choice of hotel. Apart from being closed to the main historical places in Sultanahmet, I didn't like my stay at Prince. Some of the staff are nice but others can't even speak English. I'm in my 20s and I came with my mother who's 49, we both found it hard to sleep since the our twin beds were awful!
