Orange juice and omelette for breakfast are extras,hot drinks in the room are extras(tea,coffee)!There's no iron in the room so the only option is to use the laundry service(extra charge),usage of fitness room,sauna,pool rooms etc has to be paid(6 to 10â‚¬ per hour....),the bathroom was tiny and last but not least:there's no antisound wall which means I could hear my next door neighbour on the phone,or the reception phone ringing all the time or people in the bar, it's certainly not convenient at night after you had spent a long day sightseeing and just want some sleep!And there are many other small extras here and there, which when added up altogether doesn't make it worth. I'll surely come back to Istanbul but I would rather pay more for a better hotel.It is a budget hotel, but not a 4 start at all. Barely makes it a 2/3 star in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: atlanteantitan
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend Hotel Prince to anyone. Whether your stay is for leisure or business. You will get the treatment that a prince would, this hotel certainly lives up to it's name. After a week of our stay I realized that this is where I will come back to always. I usually do not bother with recommendations but Hotel Prince certainly deserves it. Thank you everyone, you all were wonderful, keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “i like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: killyfujian
Reviews.Content: after a wonderful night you can have a wonderful breakfast,the foods delicous.and the big rooms,thats why we prefer this hotel,make feel us so relax and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “BIG EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Jenghyun
Reviews.Content: the hotel silince so great to sleep after visit old istanbul.even the hotel so near to historical place,there was so wonderful bÄ±ildings to visit,so at the end of day,you can be relax with th smily staff and silince hotel.also foods taste are so delicous too.

Reviews.Title: “see it, taste it, feel it, enjoy it.”
Reviews.Author: Janey3995
Reviews.Content: I enjoy a lot during my business trip especailly because I stayed at the right hotel. I am impressed with its considerate service, comfortable and fresh rooms with very reasonable price. I am a picky eater. But i had great meals here. I dont know how to describe it, only three words" JUST ENJOY IT"

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel Ä±n Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: cananz
Reviews.Content: Very satissfied from my stay and I'll prefer hotel prince when Ä± come to istanbul again. The rooms are very clean and the meals ara very delicious.

Reviews.Title: “visiting old istanbul staying hotel prince”
Reviews.Author: boxiaoyi
Reviews.Content: really a fantastic hotel, very good and clear. Also it is very convenient for travelling.

Reviews.Title: “A city of colture”
Reviews.Author: coccos83
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the middle of old town, were all the historic sites is. The staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast is ok for a person that dosn't normally eat breakfast and the beads is great. I dont think it mather wich age group you are in to enjoy this hotel. I was there with my mom and we both liked it :)

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Stroumpfette
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul for 3 nights, with one year old baby. The location was perfect , 2min from the tramway, 10-15 min walking distance from the spice market and Grand Bazard, 5 min from Topkapi Palace , Hagia Sophia, and Blue Mosque.We were very surprised by the hospitality and the service that we received, it was awesome. We travel a lot and it was nice to see the politeness, friendliness toward our baby and us.Everyone wanted to play with our baby. Seda our guest relation was very helpfull for informations ,but all the staff was very helpful, smily and nice. The rooms were very clean. We saw two , we change because one was too close from the street which was very quiet , no much traffic, the second was facing an interior court. The nights and days were quiet even with the renovation going on. We didn't heard in the morning the Calling from the Minarets.The rooms could be a little bigger. The top roof has a terrace with a very nice view. The breakfast was a buffet with different Turkish specialities, which were tasty and fresh. We will definitely recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very clean ,and good service”
Reviews.Author: tina061
Reviews.Content: very clean ,and good service ,i will go back,big room ,good food ,charming,i like it very much

Reviews.Title: “i will come back”
Reviews.Author: alecfly123
Reviews.Content: DO the people in hotel is very very frendly. the room is so clean and comfortable. its locat the middile of istanbul i think i will come back next year when i come to istanbul prince make me feel like my home.

Reviews.Title: “after a hard working day,relax there with the wonderful roof view”
Reviews.Author: lily1092
Reviews.Content: i was there for business.after a hard working day,i need a silince place to get relax. when i turn to hotel,the smily staff meet me and help for my rest.i relaxed at the roof,and there so wonderful view..you can see all the sea.only for this view,and the clean rooms.i prefer this hotel all my friedns to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Optimal location - worth staying”
Reviews.Author: Tarja_Oulu
Reviews.Content: Once you find this hotel for the first time, then the location is then quite perfect. You can walk to almost all main attractions (Topikapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Galata Tower, Bazaars, ferries to Asian side, even to Taksim if you like walking...). Just remember the good shoes. Around the corner there are several restaurants, shops, some bars. Our room was nice and clean. View from the 6th floor is great. Breakfast was good but note that you have to pay extra for fresh orange juice (worth it) and omelette. Gym and sauna were also chargeable. Some staff members were great, everyone was nice but some really great.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pomelotom
Reviews.Content: about the review,my home isnt so far when I am at this hotel.I can find all warmess of my family.. even those warm care me can reach the historical place by walking this hotel is the advise of my friend and right now i am agreee with his pleasure

Reviews.Title: “it is my home in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: tricychan
Reviews.Content: thanks for the hotel .when i in istanbul .they helped us so much .it is very good home for me as you know we cannot eat good without chinses food.i told them and they tell me i can cook by myself .i can inter the hitchen cook by myself .i prefer this hotel to all my chinaese friends ,coz the room is 30m2 ,this big room make us so confort .

Reviews.Title: “its a wonderful hotel i felt my self like my home.the foods and the personality of the staff are great.”
Reviews.Author: Shirleyhuang
Reviews.Content: the other visit of istanbul i stayed at Taksim but this time prefer to hotel price coz the taksim hotels wants from me to transfer of SULTANHAMET AND TOPKAPI 20USD. when i find this hotel from net,i feel so happy coz it is so near to old istanbul and those historical place. i stayed here 3 days and the rooms so clean and big.if i have chance to come again will stay here too..

Reviews.Title: “AN EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MUNEERLasVegas
Reviews.Content: Everybody was excellent specially Miss.Seda Tire & Mr.Savas,they helped me a lot for the completion of my tour . They let me have early check in and a nice breakfast on the day of arrival to this hotel. Location of this hotel is extremely good to go most of the historical places and shopping etc.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel dont be fooled by the loction”
Reviews.Author: gavin2006
Reviews.Content: clean tidy and modern staff were helpful we only had breakfast but there was plenty of choice and everthing was fresh the hotel is tucked away a bit in the back streets but its not far from anything GREAT HOTEL would recommend

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in sultanahmet/istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DAISYlondonlondon
Reviews.Content: HOTEL PRINCE is definitly perfect&reasonable place to stay in istanbul.i can highly recommend it to everybody.it is walking distance of sultanahmet so great location.we arrived the hotel very early but they allowed us to go to room.room was modern design.very clean, staff were really kind,descreet and always ready to help guests.they organized our transfers to/from the hotel also they gave us useful tips to use public transport...restaurant was nice and food was delicious .. if you go to istanbul you should choos this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “unique feel just like home”
Reviews.Author: renee1103
Reviews.Content: The rooms are so clean and fresh,the foods wonderful, breakfast are so delicous :D And the price cheap as their qualtiy Also at the roof I can see the wonderfrul view of istanbul Like their good service, I plan to choose it as the my first choice if I need book the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean !”
Reviews.Author: MaxMarius
Reviews.Content: I've been to Istanbul many times, always to find nice people and good services. Prince Hotel didn't let me down. Like I said, it is clean and nice, it has large rooms, friendly staff and it's located right in the heart of the old city, close to Agia Sofia and Topkapi. Oh, and the restaurant is pleasant and the breakfast quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near the old center”
Reviews.Author: Snowlander
Reviews.Content: The hotel is by a small and quiet street only 5-10 min walk to the Hagia Sofia, Top Kapi and Blue Mosque. Very kind staff and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Shifrance
Reviews.Content: Positive points : Comfortable hotel , situated near historical places and tramway. Free internet. Very friendly staff, particularly the guest relation. Negative point:_breakfast orange juice and omelette are "extra" charges and there are no fruits a the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: roundtripto_aus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! It had spacious rooms with clean linen and towels. The bathrooms were wonderful with large towels and clean facilities. Breakfast was delicious with a large range of foods, if you can stomach olives and turkish delight for breakfast. beware the orange juice is not free. But it was the staff the made our stay most enjoyable. They were always there with a smile to meet your every need. We were particularly impressed by the service from a staff member called Seda who had wonderful english and communication skills. She went beyond her call of duty to help us discover the wonderful city of Istanbul. The hotel is in a great location, close to the bazars, blue mosque, hagias sophere, tram line and in walking distance from ferries to other parts of the city. We would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: attidur
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from the most important places of Istanbul. Flair and nice atmosphere together with modern services (Internet, TV sat). Good Customer Care with special mention for Ms. Seda Tire. I

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice room and yummy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Strazdus
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time in Istanbul, and the location of Hotel Prince was ideal, in Sirkeci, within walking distance of Sultanahmet (Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia), Eminonu (Spice market and ferry), the Galata Bridge and Beyoglu (more modern district). We had a lovely room, they very kindly let us check in 2 hours early. There are some negatives regarding this hotel as well. You have to pay for EVERY extra, including tea and coffee in the room (1.5 YTL), which I've never come across in any hotel ever. Also, we booked thinking that use of the fitness centre and sauna were included, but actually you have to pay 10 euro for each, which is a shame. Sometimes in the bathrooms (in a couple of rooms) smelt like drains. At breakfast you even have to pay extra for orange juice, though that is mitigated by the amazing spread already on offer. The most helpful person is Seda in guest relations. She was always on hand to go out of her way to offer great suggestions on where to go, what to do and how to get there. When my Mum, who had come with us for Christmas, was unhappy with her room, it was Seda who intervened and made sure she got a great one with a view of the Galata Tower. Seda is invaluable to the hotel, as she is the one who really seems to care about the quality of the visitor experience. Overall, a fine experience, and I'd choose this hotel again on account of the location, the breakfast, and Seda's helpfulness. The hotel is very pretty, but needs to go easier on its guests wallets and not be so much like Ryanair in charging for every little extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great journey”
Reviews.Author: kamran205
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great & reasonable place to stay in Istanbul, I highly recommend HOTEL PRINCE to everyone, and its close to the shopping center & lots of great restaurant near by. (walking distance) CLEAN , MODERN , FRIENDLY They have a funny orange boy there who is orange master. and a beautiful and a nice host (SEDA) who is ready to help everyone with a beautiful smile.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for tourism in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Elta007
Reviews.Content: My brother and I including our families visited Istanbul in September 2009. Being inTurkey for the first time I was a bit worried about where to stay and where to go since I did not book a tour but I made sure to book a hotel as close as possible to the touristic places; and that's how I've chosen Prince Hotel. We had a very good deal where I managed to book the two connecting rooms with 3 beds for the children at almost a price of one room. The hotel was clean with good service except for the cooling system which did not work properly. However, this was not a big issue since we only needed it during day time. If you are used to 5 star hotels, then you would experience a lower breakfast experience. Internet is available in the lobby. If you are to visit Istanbul, I suggest that you benefit from the Customer Relations services that the hotel offers. We met Seda Tire when we first arrived; she was very helpful in planning our daily visits at the best rates. The 10 minutes you would have with her every morning will guide you to the places that you should visit and would save you a lot of money which you may end up paying had you booked a tour or made your own plans. I beleive Prince Hotel was a good choice. BR/Elie

Reviews.Title: “Gallipoli, a had to do trip”
Reviews.Author: bjjd
Reviews.Content: We were redirected to the Prince due to overload at another nearby Hotel, as it was the last night and we needed transport and an early call, we were lucky to have be3en sent to the Prince. The service was great as they arranged for a shuttle to pick us up and take us to the airport. All other service was the same, snacks, bar and the use of the internet. Will stay there again next trip

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Bobi-8081
Reviews.Content: clean, modern design rooms, good quality for a good price. great location. just a few minutes walk from main sightseeing places. We carefull - oposite hotel there is bulding under construction - some noising during a day but who stay at the hotel during a day ;-)

Reviews.Title: “My best summer holiday in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ypataran
Reviews.Content: I have spent two holidays in Hotel Prince-Istanbul and compare with every place where I have been it is the best one there .I am too pretentiousness I have to admit, but this hotel is a little peace of the city's paradise .My partner and I , have extremely perfect holidays there . We are travelling very often and for sure every time when we will be in Istanbul , this hotel will be always our first choice , Yana Bulgaria

Reviews.Title: “BELISSIMO!”
Reviews.Author: BakuIlkin
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff is perfect, and too friendly..the rooms are more then perfect...the view from Balcony the Gulhane park, the see....it is look like a fairy tale:)was eonderful to stay there... i am going minimum 2 times to Istanbul in a year with my angel, and for sure, i willnot change never my hotel again:)) cos if ound what i looked:) there is nothing to say something bad....really:)

Reviews.Title: “In Istanbul, Hotel Prince is well located and very good in all reapects”
Reviews.Author: slowalan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Prince is well located near the Bosphorus in a new multi storied building in the old part of town below Haigha Sophia. It is in a narrow laneway, which is quiet at night, and the hotel has a good dining room and rooftop area with good views.It is easy walking distance to attractions such as the Spice market, grand Bazaar, Cistern etc. Turkish breakfsts are not to everyone's taste, but Hotel Prince has one of the best of the twenty or so we tried on our tour, The other food is fine, as is a good but simple room service menu.there are very many restaurants near the Hotel, and I want to recommend Hamdi which is one of the best affordable barbecue/kebab restaurants in Turkey. Rooms at the Hotel Prince are very clean and big enough, but not many have a good view., Good wirelessInternet is free and the staff are very helpful and efficient in all matters, I had to use their photocopying service and it was really quick, as was the laundry service. Guest relations are a feature at Hotel Princie I think, and they meet and great with pastries and apple tea..this freindlienss continues throughout your visit, I will defineitely stay there again, and the sooner the better..I have developed a great fondness for Turkey and its people.

Reviews.Title: “It was a delight to be at Hotel Prince,Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Hussainh
Reviews.Content: We were a group of ten people and stayed at Hotel Prince for 6 days.It was an excellent choice to stay at a place full of friendly people at your service all the times.The place was clean with good sized rooms and with all the facilities.Location was brilliant with most of tourist attractions within walking distance.There was a huge selection of food at the buffet breakfast every morning and a lot of people to look after us.The guest relations officer was a delightful girl who helped and advised us whenever we needed her services. We highly recommend Hotel Prince to anyone visiting Istanbul. Thankyou Hotel Prince for making our trip even more delightful ! Dr. & Mrs. Hussain Haider

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasent stay, kind and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: Pinzonid
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and 2 teenager daughters) and me stayed recently in the Hotel Prince in Istanbul. It was an excellent experience. I had already been in this hotel last June, and had enjoyed the warmth of their staff and attention. The hotel is very well located in Sulatnahmed, Old Istanbul, walking distance from Hagia Sophia, Blue Mesquite, Hyppodrome, Grand Bazar, Cistern Cathedral and in general to all places in old Istanbul. The hotel offers internal ammenities (gym, sauna, good food, a bar and Disco)and services (internet.) We arrived at difficult times of the day and the staff was very helpful and efficient in accomodating our family in rooms comfortable for a familiy our size. The Guest Relation officer in particular was very kind and helpful, always attentive to guests' needs. I strongly recommend considering the Hotel Prince for any visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable hotel with friendly staff and good service”
Reviews.Author: OzTravellers2009
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights at the Hotel Prince and really enjoyed our stay.The hotel was clean and comfortable, the room was good ,the staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good. I would recommend this hotel for people wishing to stop near the old city in Istanbul. Note we requested to move to this hotel after an unpleasant experience at another hotel the "Ottoman Legacy hotel"(see separate review of this hotel) The move to the Prince was a good decision and Seda TiRE and the staff at the Hotel Prince made us most welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, staff made stay very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sahsan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location all the major attractions are within walking distance. The staff were very fiiendly and helpful highly reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: Diane_Robin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not our first choice, but nevertheless it was in a good location,quiet, but only a few minutes walk from the Tram. Rooms are spacious and well equipped - attracts lots of group travel. Breakfast was buffet style and very generous - but beware, they do charge extra for the delicious freshly squeezed orange juice. Staff generally very helpful. Good restaurants to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: squirrelPerth
Reviews.Content: Tracy and I throughly enjoyed our stay at your hotel. The staff were both friendly and helpful. The location was wonderful, central and great to be able to walk to all the main attractions. The only tip would be to have more staff who spoke English on reception. Overall it was so wonderful we've let all our friends in Australia know about it. Kind Regards, Robyn Davies

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrumpyAustralia
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Prince at both the beginning and end of a fortnight's tour of Turkey. I recommend it wholeheartedly. The staff were efficient and helpful. I would particularly like to thank Seda, of Guest Relations. She was a source of information about everything we needed to know, and nothing was ever a problem for her. In addition, the Hotel Prince is located in the centre of everything in Sultanahmet, so most of Istanbul's tourist attractions are within walking distance if the hotel. I would stay there again if I ever return to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Relax in the shade of Topkapi Palace”
Reviews.Author: friendlyeyes
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Prince is located in the heart of the old quarter of Sirkeci, at the edge of the Gulhane Park in the shade of the Topkapi Palace. Agia Sophia, Sultan Ahmed mosque, several museums, The High Gate are within easy walking distance as well as the Galata Bridge and the quaies of all the ferries, tour boats and pleasure ships.Besides all the ameneties of a well kept 4star hotel this is the biggest asset of the Hotel Prince. No, I must correct myself; the biggest asset is the competent, polite and very friendly staff.People you can come to with whatever ails you. They always show compassion and have the right answer.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, not pricy.”
Reviews.Author: Zoeluma
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a nice surprise to us. It is well located with easy access to famous sites in Istanbul,like St. Sofia, Blue Mosque, Graand Bazar, Spice bazar,etc... lots of restaurants around it. There is a Metro construction next to it, but it doesn't affect the quality of the hotel! Warm welcoming from P.R. Seda Tire, very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb! - Excellent! - Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyOf4London_UK
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via an EasyJet package. On reading the reviews on Trip Advisor it was actually our second choice - our first choice having been booked out. Some of the reviews which some previous hotel guests commented on, on Trip Advisor was that the rooms were very small (which is why it was our second choice)...not big enough to put your suitcase. How far from the truth that is - the rooms are spacious! I e-mailed EasyJet a few times to ensure that the rooms were spacious because both our children are Special Needs and they need the space. EasyJet tried to ensure that we were booked into spacious rooms. On turning up at the hotel, we were greeted by the Guest Relations lady - name: Seda Tire; she handed sweets to the kids which was very welcoming. We were shown to our room which in my opinion was very spacious - it had 3 single beds PLUS we were given an adjoining room with a double bed! We are a family of 4 - we paid for one room but were given two rooms! We didn't make use of the room with double bed and we asked the hotel to sell it to another guest, but they refused and insisted we keep it to ensure we were comfortable even though we say we will not use it but may do. After the second night the hotel did need the double bedroom in the end and offered us another room which was one room but absolutely massive! See our photos of the rooms in the photos section. One end of the room had a massive double bed and the other end had two lounge chairs converted to single beds. We had so much space we didn't know what to do with it! So the other comments on this site that say the rooms are small are not true at all; I know we sent prior e-mails to EasyJet asking for spacious rooms but we peered into other rooms as they were being cleaned and all were spacious. Not only spacious but also nicely decorated, clean and comfortable. The bathroom, which was also very spacious, had a jacuzzi which was nice. The shower is the most powerful I have encountered - on full power - it could have blown you away - it was awesome! The breakfast had a good range of food - breads, cakes, hard boiled egg, sausages, hash browns, cold meats, cheeses, honey and lots of ranges of jam, watermelon. The only downside issues for the breakfast were as follows: you had to pay extra for an omelette, you had to pay extra for freshly squeezed orange juice (the prices are displayed but the price list is not prominent and if you drunk from the glass without first signing the slip you were stuck!). There were only two cereals to choose from - plain cornflakes and chocolate cornflakes. The tea they offer is the Turkish tea which wasn't to our taste and normal black tea is an extra cost but we were not charged. About the guest relations woman - Seda Tire...she was one of the main reasons our stay was comfortable. She was great with the kids - giving them sweets only if they finished their breakfast! She was friendly, charming and walked around the tables asking if guests were OK. One morning when our older child had a tantrum which made us feel very embarrassed, Seda was able to calm her down within seconds. The hotel manager Ozgur was also very charming with the kids. It is a very child-friendly hotel. There are two PCs in the lobby with free internet access. The hotel is situated away from the busy main street with many car spare part shops around which isn't such a big deal. The location is superb - the 'Gulhane' tram stop is around 5 minutes' walk away and that stop is one stop away from the main tourist area of Sultanahmet - it's slightly uphill from the Gulahne stop to Sultanahmet - not very steep at all - so a tram would benefit those with children, Special Needs / Disabled and the Elderly, otherwise you could easily walk to Sultanahmet - it's around a 10 minute walk. The Bosphorous is around 10-12 minutes' walk away with the ferries going to the Asian side. On the way from the hotel to the Bosphorous are plenty of fast food places - both Turkish and Burger King / McDonald's. There is a small supermarket around 3 minutes from the hotel called 'Dia' where you can stock up on lots of things like mineral water (greatly cheaper than the hotels!), snacks, fruit, etc. There are lots of tourist shops around - be war of the prices - it's cheaper at the Grand Bazaar (which is 2 stops away from the Gulhane tram stop)! The Spice Bazaar is around a 15 minute walk away. In a nutshell - very very ideally situated. In some of the earlier reviews there is mention of a building site next to the hotel - a link to a tram line is being built, but the workmen discovered some Roman remains so it's presently an Archeological site until the ruins are moved to the Hagia Sofia. The only negative aspects to the hotel are as follows, and these points still do not even dent the praise we have for the hotel: - We e-mailed the hotel about the room size issue - the responses were vague and further e-mails were not answered. I questioned the Deputy Manager about thi; he apologised and cited it was a busy period which is true because the hotel was very busy - In our room there was the smell of cigarette smoke coming from the air conditioning vent. The manager said she was personally investigating the matter citing it's probably one of the hotel staff secretly smoking in the basement (the hotel has a non-smoking policy) - We had to call the service engineer engineer twice - once because the air conditioning wasn't going on - our own stupidity - we needed to put the key into the slot by the door to get the electrics in the room working - on that occasion we had to call the reception 3 times for the guy to come up; the second time we called him for another reason he came promptly - the rooms facing the lobby - you hear some clinking of crockery/cutlery from the restaurant below - it's the way the inside of the hotel is designed - see photos section with pics posted by another guest All I can say is that this hotel is SUPERB!!! It rates itself as 4 star which although is a tad below 4 star by Western European standards, is still extremely nice. I would (a) definitely recommend other people to stay there, and (b) stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: odaliscabrasileira
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Prince Hotel in Istambul and was extremely pleased with the facilities, cleanliness and courtesy of the staff. The guest relations officer, Ms. Seda Tire, was extremely courteous during my stay welcoming our group and being very attentive to our needs . The other members of the hotel staff were also very courteous. The location is great because we can walk to all the important monuments in the old part of the town. The rooms were very clean, tidy and comfortable. There are only a couple of suggestions IÂ´d like to make, regarding the room, there should be blankets in the closet as the air conditioning can get quite cold during the night and during my stay there were none available. The other suggestion has to do with breakfast - we, Brazilians are used to have orange juice included in our breakfast, and the price of the orange juice in the coffee shop where we had our breakfast was too high. Other than that I congratulate the Hotel management and staff for the wonderful stay I had.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely great place to stay in Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: sjvyas
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife just returned after 6 days in Istanbul and enjoyed our stay at the Prince. If you are looking for a clean room, great location, and reasonable prices, this is where you want to stay. The lady in charge of guest relations personally stopped by each guest's table during breakfast every morning to say hello and offer help and assistance. Not many places offer this level of service. Carol and Sam Vyas

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: NunoM
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Hotel Prince for a entire week and we have enjoyed every minute. The hotel is great, a very new and modern building, everything is absolutely clean and the rooms are very comfortable, but not very large. The staff is wonderful, always available to help you, especially Seda. We never used the restaurant for lunch or dinner, but the breakfast was nice. You can have a continental, an English or a Turkish breakfast if you want. I agree with some reviewers that the orange juice and other stuff cooked at the minute could be included, but it is very clear that you must pay an extra value for it. We also enjoyed the great terrace, the very nice LCD and the internet in the business centre. Despite being located in the old part of the city, the street is very quiet, and we almost didn't notice the noise from the metro working. We really believe that the location is one of the better values of this hotel. It's in a walking distance to Topkapi castle (5 minutes), Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosk (10 minutes) and Grand Bazar (15 minutes). There is also a tram stop just behind the building and you can also walk to the train and ferry stations (10 minutes). There also many restaurant nearby. If you want to visit all the important sites in Istanbul and have a good rest at the the end of the day, definitely Hotel Prince is a perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Prince was an excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AustralianTourist78
Reviews.Content: The Prince was a great place to stay in Instanbul. Close to all attractions, large comfortable rooms, and friendly staff. We would like to especially thank Seda Tire for her outstanding level of service and friendliness. In addition, Osge at reception was most obliging and helpful to us. We would definitely stay at the Prince next time in Instanbul and would recommend to friends. Fred & Marlene Wintle Australia

Reviews.Title: “Beutiful building, nice location, getting better. I thing deserve five stars”
Reviews.Author: ALBADRI
Reviews.Content: 1)Building is wonerful & Rooms are beutiful & clean. 2)Location is very nice due to the safe area and quitness and near to most important sightseeing like: The Eyptian Grand Bazar (15 mins. walk) , The Blue Mosque (10 mins. walk), commercial shops and banks and change money stores(5 mins. walk), The Grand Park in istanbul (5 mins. walk), and The railway is just two mins. away from the hotel. 3)I think this hotel deserve five stars if they enhance some weakness like: resturant food variety & the rooms service need to add more working hours to serve rooms in late time. 4)Staff are friendly and willing to help guests as much as they can. The managers also always helping guests in solving any problems they face. I think the future is PRINCE HOTEL. Good luck. Thank you for your hospitality & see you inshallah next time in Istanbul. Yours, Abdulhakeem

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but could do better”
Reviews.Author: arianaLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is excellent you will be surprice how easy it is to find your way around from the hotel all the main attration are walking distance but hotel itself could do better i am not sure how hotels are rated in Turkey but this was acceptable 3* soley because rooms are small there are no irons in the room you will have to pay for your clothes to be ironed tea and coffe is charged too but hotel staff are nice and promt very polite always smiles and try to help out .breakfast was nice but every day same routine you must try the potatos they are mouth watering. bussiness centre with two computer that normally doent work and are in turkish there is a DEDECATED GUEST RELATION STAFF SHE IS VERY PLEASENT ALWAYS TRY TO OFFER HELP AND MAKE YOUR STAY COMFORTABLE BUT HER KNOWLEGE IN THE AREA ARE LIMITED although she tries but ............... but she is very nice and helpfull. over all i will deffinetly stay again it is well worth it you will not regeret it .

Reviews.Title: “very good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bathar
Reviews.Content: in my opinion its a very good and best hotel in the area but good bit better on break fast selection

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to visit Istanbul BUT very bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: segua
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel is very well located, is clean, the room has a good size, the personnel is nice. It is a mid category hotel with a good price (we bought it as a package). Wifi is free and it has been part of the success of our trip since we could organize our day at the last minute. Cons: The breakfast is the only reason why I wouldn't return. Breads are regular pointing to bad, there is no fruits except watermelon, cheeses are peculiar to my taste, few warm variety of very cheap food (potatoes, frankfurt sausajes,...). Orange juices and eggs are charged has extra. Why don't you offer less variety but better quality: good croissants (aren't they turkish?), baklavas, fruits (turkey produces a lot of mediterranean fruits and you can buy in the street, at the hotel doors, cherries, apricots, bananas, pears, peaches, fresh figs,...), eggs (but not very important to me) and juices (at least free orange juice). Breakfast wouldn't be has important for somebody who would stay only one night but for 6 days, it is boring and we started each day with a bad feeling. The street is not very nice but it is not very important, it is quiet despite the work they are making (a metro o aerchological searches).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in the centre of the Old City”
Reviews.Author: frogmouth53
Reviews.Content: What a delight to find tea/coffee making facilities, fridge and a welcome package of tea, coffee and biscuits waiting for us on our arrival. With little supermarkets, bakeries and countless eateries just around the corner, it was easy to top up these things as we consumed them. The location couldn't be better, as it was close to the big mosques, bazaars, gardens, the waterfront, and the tram stops just around the corner. Take the tram to its terminus in one direction and it is only a short walk to the Dolmabache Palace. Ride in the other direction and there are stops close to the Grand Bazaar and the Topkapi Palace. The room was modern and clean, staff friendly and our laundry promptly returned by the afternoon. Front desk organised day tours for us and a video camera inadvertantly left in the lobby was waiting for us at reception on our return from one of the tours. We even caught up on an episode of 'Desperate Housewives' (with Turkish sub-titles) on the inroom TV. We liked the piped music in the lobby: Christmas carols in May, Handel's Largo and classical violin. There was a worksite beside the hotel when we stayed there, but it wasn't too intrusive and progress has to happen. We've encountered the same thing in other busy cities around the world. All in all, we were very happy with this little treasure.

Reviews.Title: “You will feel welcomed”
Reviews.Author: zugi70
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a central location. Sight seeing spots in walking distance. Excellent guest relation.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: FunTimePa
Reviews.Content: A month ago I stayed with my husband at Prince Hotel for our honeymoon. We stayed for a week. We had a pleasant stay, with realiable room service and was particularly happy with the breakfast selection it offered. The staff was friendly and welcoming throughout our stay. I suggest Prince Hotel in Istanbul for anyone whop is looking for a relaxing get away alone or with loved ones !

Reviews.Title: “Its a nice hotel but a little downpoints”
Reviews.Author: shabana87
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights we had a triple room which was good size and was clean, only one thing the air con was not good at all and the room remained stuffy. We had a little issue about the iron as the advertising we seen stated iron provided, when we arrived the next morning they stated there was no iron in the hotel and they can only provide us with a laundry and pressing service which we were to be charged for. The issue was sorted when I showed them the evidence of the advertisement. They done the ironing for free which was really nice of them. As for the breakfast all was good they had mixture of pastryâ€™s, jam, cornflakes, etc but there is a charge for fresh juice and also if you want an omelette made so watch out! The rest is all part of the breakfast. Loctaion wise itâ€™s close to all the attractions â€“ 10 mins walk to Grand Bazaar and 5 min walk to the blue mosque taxis are everywhere and the main tram is two mins away from the hotel. Safe area, few building works going on around the building but all was good. Staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A bunch of thieves!!!”
Reviews.Author: znisa123
Reviews.Content: What a nightmare staying in this hotel. We stayed there for 8 nights, although the location was good, there is a building site right outside the hotel, the workmen start work at 7am til 7pm. A metro station is being built and wont be completed til 2012. I found the hotel staff rude and arrogant. The room key had to to be reset every time we returned to the hotel in the evening, which is very inconvenient when you get back to your hotel at 1am. I was lucky to see the same people again, as they were all leaving. The staff were leaving due to their money and belongings being stolen from their staff room. On the 2nd day , unfortunately our fellow travellers from Germany had their passports and money stolen from there room whilst they were out. We got a room with a broken bed, after complaining the rrom was changed to a room with a bad smelling air conditioning sytem, and a broken fridge (mini-bar). Unfortunatley when i checked out i left my jacjet in the wardroce, upon returning to the UK i called the hotel promptly and was told that they will check with housekeeping and i should call in the morning. The morning after i was told that the jacket was never found nor handed in by housekeeping!!!!! getting a regular cab to the airport would cost you no more than 35lira, the hotel charged us 54lira & 22euro (apparantly they charge per person. To top it all off, i dont know how this can be a 4star hotel..the travelodge and the hoiday inn are a million times better and more accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “could have been great...”
Reviews.Author: MarkBrownAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just spent the weekend in Istanbul, sleeping at the Prince Hotel. We decided on the hotel due to reviews here on tripadvisor, thinking that a poor breakfast wouldn't matter so much to us: we tend to sleep in on weekends. In any case, upon arrival at the hotel, we were pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and decent service. However, upon entering our clean and reasonably well decorated room, we noticed a bad smell...something like dried urine. I thought maybe the air in the room was just stale, but when I turned on the air conditioning, it became clear that this horrible smell was emanating from the ventilation system. I complained to the hotel, and finally a rather surly "technician" came up and said that nothing was wrong...he just looked me in the eye and told me that it didn't smell bad. However, another hotel staff person was there, and he admitted sheepishly that it DID smell bad. The hotel told us there was nothing they could do that night (full hotel), and we ultimately tried to solve the problem by keeping the window open. This was not ideal, as it can be a rather noisy neighborhood. We ultimately did not switch rooms because we were so entranced with Istanbul, that we didn't get back to our room late the following night (and the next, as well). If this is an isolated problem to our room (5508), avoid it. As mentioned in other reviews, the breakfast is a big disappointment (we tried it once) - and YES...they want to charge for the orange juice. It's very odd the way it's set up. The food on offer is not healthy or tasty, and the large vats of jam and honey are not particularly hygienic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: nicuflor
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this Hotel.my trip was perfect.Clean services, light, food was excellent, staff very prompt and friendly .Hotel is located in a very interesting area. can reach very easily and quickly in all places of interest .if I trip again in Istanbul I will choose the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a super hotel.we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: ynter
Reviews.Content: a super hotel,an extraordinary reception.situated an the bank bosfor,with a superb.an ireproachable service.i recommend to all who come to istanbul city.we'll be back!!!!!!!!choice this destinations!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Environment, very peaceful”
Reviews.Author: amisdhanak
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the 5th time and i like because it in the centre of the city and walking distance to touristic spot like Grand Bazaar, Aya Sofya Mosque and the Blue Mosque. 2 minutes walk to the Tram way station, Train Station and the boat station. I like the atmosphere, good for romance and business both.

Reviews.Title: “very nice location .”
Reviews.Author: khalid_sas
Reviews.Content: i want to thank the hotel mangment for all services. it,s realy good place

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul, my loved city”
Reviews.Author: Sel20
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel last year at my first stay in Istanbul. The location is very good. We could easily find all the seesights by walking. Also at the reception we received all the necesary informations. The acces to the local transport was also very easy, only 2 minutes walking to the closest tram station, 5 minutes to the ship station. I saw that the company offers also transportation to the airport (I saw people coming or leaving during my stay), but it was not may case. I came by my own car. Arriving at the hotel, I felt like a princess. The hotel staff made me feel very good, I was like in the moves (when you came by car and from the hotel are coming 2-3 people, to park your car, to take your luggage, to open the door for you). The room was very nice and clean. The sheets and the towels were changed every day and the room was cleaned. The brakfast room was also nice, and the brakfast was soo rich, and so many sortiments to choose from, that were making the choosing very difficult (you would have wanted to eat from all of them). The brakfast includes not only turkish meals, but also european meals. During the summer, the roof of the hotel it is transformed into a place to eat. From there you have a great view of the Bosforus. I would recomand this hotel if you wish to have a pleasant stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Was OK”
Reviews.Author: AllegraBologna
Reviews.Content: I have have spent few days in september and would advice everyone who is planning to go to Istanbul. The Hotel location is perfect to see the historical places of Istanbul. Room was nice and very clean. Excellent quality of food and beverage. The hotel staff is nice and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden extras”
Reviews.Author: DubaiWorldtraveller
Reviews.Content: The best thing of the Prince Hotel is the location. Everything within walking distance. Also the tram very close by. The hotel itself is in a quiet side straat. The room was neat but small. We were not pleased about a lot of hidden extras. When you enter the breakfast room they ask you if you would like some fresh orange juice. Yes, please. After that you notice the signboard telling you that a fresh orange juice cost EUR 3,50. The breakfast itself is nothing to write home about. If you want an omelette you have to pay an extra EUR 3. We choose the hotel because of their location and their gym. The first day we went to explose the gym in the basement. There were no ligths on and nobody to be seen. So we went to the reception to enquire. They told us when you want to use the gym tell us 10 minutes in advance and we will make it available to you. It cost EUR 10 per person. So, we never saw the gym. Also the use of the pool billiard was EUR 6. I don't think this is a 4 star hotel. In a 4 star hotel you would have shower/bath gel and body lotion in the bathroom. Also there was no bath stopper in the bath. At the reception we finally got one. I think when you pay EUR 150 they should not ask you to pay for all these extras. We will not visit the Prince hotel again for these reasons.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Prince
HotelInfo.Address: Nobethane Caddesi Kargili Sok. No: 5 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34113, Turkey
